text: Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation.

The hardship of Isolation


			When it comes to talking about the hardships of Isolation, we have a lot of choices.

When it comes to talking about the hardships of Isolation, we have a lot of choices.

The Hardship of Isolation


When it comes to talking about the hardships of Isolation, we have a lot of choices. We can talk about how scary it is to be alone, how lonely it feels, and the gnawing fear of abandonment that we carry around.

The Struggles and Loneliness of Isolation


We can talk about how scary it is to be alone, how lonely it feels, and the gnawing fear of abandonment that we carry around. We can talk about how it hurts to be rejected and criticized, and how it feels to be ignored.

We can talk about how scary it is to be alone, how lonely it feels, and the gnawing fear of abandonment that we carry around. We can talk about how it hurts to be rejected and criticized, and how it feels to be ignored. We can talk about the fear of being on our own, and of having to depend on ourselves.

The Struggles and Loneliness of Isolation


We can talk about how scary it is to be alone, how lonely it feels, and the gnawing fear of abandonment that we carry around. We can talk about how it hurts to be rejected and criticized, and how it feels to be ignored. We can talk about the fear of being on our own, and of having to depend on ourselves. We can talk about the anxiety that we feel when life doesn’t go as planned, and how we can fall apart when our plans are derailed.  We can talk about how we’ve tried to do everything in our power to fit in, and yet somehow we're always on our own. Lovers leave us, friends slowly disappear from our lives either because they've moved to another state or country or perhaps they moved on with someone else.

We can talk about how we’ve tried to do everything in our power to fit in, and yet somehow we're always on our own. Lovers leave us, friends slowly disappear from our lives either because they've moved to another state or country or perhaps they moved on with someone else. We can talk about how we've always wanted to believe that there is someone out there for us, but our dreams have been shattered by disappointment.

The Struggles and Loneliness of Isolation


We can talk about how scary it is to be alone, how lonely it feels, and the gnawing fear of abandonment that we carry around. We can talk about how it hurts to be rejected and criticized, and how it feels to be ignored. We can talk about the fear of being on our own, and of having to depend on ourselves. We can talk about the anxiety that we feel when life doesn’t go as planned, and how we can fall apart when our plans are derailed.  We can talk about how we’ve tried to do everything in our power to fit in, and yet somehow we're always on our own. Lovers leave us, friends slowly disappear from our lives either because they've moved to another state or country or perhaps they moved on with someone else. ..

We can talk about how we've always wanted to believe that there is someone special out there for us, but our dreams have been shattered by disappointment again and again. But to our credit, we find a way to somehow continue to live and survive in this world. It rarely easy or without pain or struggle, but somehow we make it from one day to the next.

The Struggles and Loneliness of Isolation


We can talk about how scary it is to be alone, how lonely it feels, and the gnawing fear of abandonment that we carry around. We can talk about how it hurts to be rejected and criticized, and how it feels to be ignored. We can talk about the fear of being on our own, and of having to depend on ourselves. We can talk about the anxiety that we feel when life doesn’t go as planned, and how we can fall apart when our plans are derailed.  We can talk about how we’ve tried to do everything in our power to fit in, and yet somehow we're always on our own. Lovers leave us, friends slowly disappear from our lives either because they've moved to another state or country or perhaps they moved on with someone else. ..

We can talk about how we've always wanted to believe that there is someone special out there for us, but our dreams have been shattered by disappointment again and again. We can talk about how we hoped to have friends that would last a lifetime, friends who would be there for us no matter what. But life and situations change as do people and relationships, and nothing ever lasts forever. Our best friends and close family members can be the ones that hurt us the most. The very people that we would do anything for, but sadly leave us in the end...

But to our credit, we find a way to somehow continue to live and survive in this world. It rarely easy or without pain or struggle, but somehow we make it from one day to the next. We always hope that tomorrow will bring a better day even if it rarely does. We find things to do to keep our minds occupied and to distract from the pain of loneliness that slowly eats away at us from within. For some of us, the struggle continues every day, but some find their way in time you just have to keep at it. Find people that share and enjoy your hobbies and passions, and never give up hope that tomorrow could be the day that changes your life in a better way forever. Maybe not all of us will find soul mates, but never let the dream die and the hope shall remain eternal.
